events.description:
Chicago native, singer-songwriter Britt Dignan has the ability to capture your heart with his talent for writing meaningful lyrics placed smoothly over his slick Acoustic melodies and impromptu jams. He paints a picture with his folky story telling, soulful rooted voice and extraordinary stage presence, placed a top a high energized passion and love for music!

Joining the midwest music scene in early 2005, Britt has shared the stage with many nationally touring bands and playing a plethora of well known Venues and establishments. He has become an accomplished Singer/Songwriter throughout the Midwest and its surrounding states. Also taking part in his share of touring and multiple projects over the years. His band is made up of some the finest musicians in Chicago and has the benefit of having many guest musicians at any given show.

His first full length album "Ordinary Life" was released in late January, 2014 and has concert goers of all ages raving over his fresh southern folk style and old timey blues jams with a jazzy twist. You will find yourself singing his catchy songs over and over again. Such as, “Friendly Neighbors”, Get's You High”, and his hit single “Lover's and Sinners”. Britt Dignan was voted "Chicago Deli Magazine's, Artist Of The Month" August 2014, and plans to release another album in late 2015.
events.title: Live Music with Britt Dignan
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

The music will be bangin', the beer will be flowin', and the lederhosen and drndls will be sportin'. Mark your calendars now!

events.description:
Make plans Saturday October 15, 2016 to attend the second annual Pub in the Park Craft Beer Festival being held at Sunset Park in the Village of Lake in the Hills, IL.

This year's Pub in the Park is planned for 2000 beer lovers and guests to enjoy great beers from 40+ Breweries, Food Trucks and Live Music all on site to make for a fantastic day!

Pub in the Park Craft Beer Festival will run from 3pm - 4pm for VIP admission and from 4pm - 7:30pm for general admission. Last pour will be 7:15pm. At the front entrance you will receive an ID wristband and Pub in the Park Fest souvenir tasting glass to samples all of the great beers available. T-Shirts and other swag will be available for purchase. Visit our Facebook page and like us to receive all the Pub in the Park Beer Fest news and updates.

A special designated driver ticket is available. No alcohol will be served to attendees wearing a DD wristband. Nonalcoholic drinks will be available.

Pub in the Park is hosted by People for Parks Foundation of LITH, Inc. and is a 501(c) 3 not for profit organization for the purpose of supporting the Lake in the Hills' Parks and Recreation Department. The foundation provides equipment for parks and the Lake in the Hills Preschool Academy and scholarship support to encourage participation in department programs for families in need. ALL the proceeds raised directly benefit residents who use the LITH Parks and Recreation Programs.

All sales are final. Tickets price will only be refunded in the event of cancellation. You must present a valid photo ID (driver's license, passport or military ID) at the entrance. No outside beer is permitted. The site is wheel chair accessible. No animals will be allowed other than seeing-eye dogs and other medical service dogs.
events.title: Pub in the Park Craft Beer Fest
events.location: Sunset Park in the Village of Lake in the Hills, IL

Draft line up and donation %'s will be announced as we get closer, but you'll see draft beers from Revolution Brewing, Hailstorm Brewing Co., Half Acre Beer Company, Transient Artisan Ales, Lagunitas Brewing Co, Pipeworks Brewing Company, Pollyanna Brewing Company, and Ballast Point Brewing & Spirits!

events.description:
Hop Stop 2016

Riverside Foods and the Olmsted Society are once again partnering to bring you the Hop Stop craft beer festival. Sample offerings from micro-local craft brewers such as Pollyanna, Brickstone, Lake Effect, Lagunitas, Aquanaut, Kinslahger, Pipeworks, BuckleDown, Miskatonic, Marz, Hailstorm Brewing, and Riverside’s own Quincy Street Distilling, among others, Saturday, September 24, 2016, 4 to 7 pm at the Riverside Train Station, Riverside, IL. The Metra drops you at the door. Food trucks (food available for purchase), and the live music of HopsLager and The Leadfoot Band round out a wonderful outdoor family friendly setting in the arboretum Village of Riverside. Commemorative tasting glass is provided with each $30 ticket price and this will be a zero waste event.
100% of the proceeds from the event go to the Olmsted Society in preserving and promoting Frederick Law Olmsted’s vision and fostering a sustainable future. See www.olmstedsociety.org for more information on this nearly 50 year old non-profit organization and its good works.

events.description:
Join Good Beer Hunting for a late summer hang  — in collaboration with 5 Rabbit Cerveceria, the brewery that brought us Paletas, those colorful, fruity popsicle-inspired beers of the Chicago summer, we're kicking off a new event focused specifically on fruited beers. 

We're gathering a bunch of our brewing friends to bring you some of the best fruit-infused, and fruit-fermented beers around, as well as some new one-off experiments. 

We'll be hosting the small festival at 5 Rabbit brewery — so if you haven't yet gotten out to see their new taproom, this is as good a reason as you'll get. 

Tons of great beer, some summery food, and summer jams. Join us, and help make the first Summer Crushes festival one of those lasting summer memories you hold in your heart for years to come. 

5 Rabbit Brewery — 6398 74th St, Bedford Park, IL 60638

events.description:
Chicago native, singer-songwriter Britt Dignan has the ability to capture your heart with his talent for writing meaningful lyrics placed smoothly over his slick Acoustic melodies and impromptu jams. He paints a picture with his folky story telling, soulful rooted voice and extraordinary stage presence, placed a top a high energized passion and love for music!

Joining the midwest music scene in early 2005, Britt has shared the stage with many nationally touring bands and playing a plethora of well known Venues and establishments. He has become an accomplished Singer/Songwriter throughout the Midwest and its surrounding states. Also taking part in his share of touring and multiple projects over the years. His band is made up of some the finest musicians in Chicago and has the benefit of having many guest musicians at any given show.

His first full length album "Ordinary Life" was released in late January, 2014 and has concert goers of all ages raving over his fresh southern folk style and old timey blues jams with a jazzy twist. You will find yourself singing his catchy songs over and over again. Such as, “Friendly Neighbors”, Get's You High”, and his hit single “Lover's and Sinners”. Britt Dignan was voted "Chicago Deli Magazine's, Artist Of The Month" August 2014, and plans to release another album in late 2015.
events.title: Live Music with Britt Dignam
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont IL 60439

events.description: Raise a glass and raise some funds for men’s health in Movember. On Saturday, November 19th from 12pm-5pm, Pollyanna Brewing Company and Imperial Oak Brewing again join forces in a collaborative effort to bring you a new beer and raise money for men's health as part of our annual “Movembeer” event! We’ve teamed up to again create a Double Oatmeal Stout, but this year, we've each added a unique fruit to the base beer! You can grab a glass or growler of our Elderberry version, then take a free trolley ride to grab one of Imperial Oak's Raspberry version. And then, you can take the trolley BACK AND FORTH for unique one-off versions of each! A portion of every commemorative glass sale goes to Movember! We’ll have raffles, live music, a mustache contest for all (men and women), and Brazilian eats from Rockin Rodizio. Get your MO’ growing and join us for a cheers to great beer and men's health in Movember!
events.title: MOVEMBEER Celebration with Imperial Oak
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

events.description:
Sample ciders and seasonal beers in the midst of rich fall color at the Cider and Ale Festival. Sip on local favorites and explore new craft ciders and beers while enjoying the beautiful surroundings of The Morton Arboretum. Find more details here: http://bit.ly/2c8VGcd

Guest restaurants and Arboretum concessions will be available on-site for purchase. Bring a chair or lie down on a blanket in the crisp Autumn air while listening to live music. This event is rain or shine; please come prepared.

2016 Event Details:
VIP Tickets:
$60/members; $70/nonmembers
VIP ticket holders are admitted to event at noon.

General Admission:
$40/members; $50/nonmembers
General Admission ticket holders are admitted to event at 1 p.m.

Designated Driver Tickets:
$15/person
Designated Driver ticket holders are admitted at 1:00 p.m. If accompanying a VIP ticket holder, the Designated Driver ticket holder will be admitted at noon. 

Location: Outdoors near the Visitor Center

*Please Note: This event is for those 21 and over. No one under the age of 21 will be admitted, including infants. No exceptions. Tickets can be purchased onsite on the day of the event. Tickets purchased day-of will have an additional $5 fee.
events.title: Cider and Ale Festival
events.location: The Morton Arboretum 4100 IL-53, Lisle, Illinois 60532

events.description:
We recently turned 2 years old, so let's celebrate with a bottle release, all sorts of special tappings, hot jams, food trucks, and crafted optimism. 

22oz bottles of Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Oatmeal Stout will be sold for $18 (tax included). This beast of a beer was aged in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels for 12 months and comes in at 10.5% ABV with all sorts of sticky sweet oats, rich chocolates, dark fruits, and woody whiskey notes. It will be on draft in limited quantities as well. We'll also have anniversary glassware (logo'd Teku Goblets) on sale for $15 or FREE with the purchase of 4 bomber bottles.

Beer Schedule:
12pm - Tapping and bottle release of Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Oatmeal Stout (Imperial Oatmeal Stout aged for 12 months in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels)
1pm - Tapping of Cask Conditioned Personal Chain Letter with Ghost Pepper (THAT'S A SPICY MEATBALL)
2pm - Tapping of 2015 Personal Chain Letter (The OG)
3pm - Tapping of 2016 Bourbon Barrel Aged Personal Chain Letter (Imperial Stout aged for 10 months in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels)
4pm - Tapping of 2015 Orenda Volume 02 (Red Wine Barrel Aged Belgian Quadrupel)
5pm - Tapping of Second Anniversary Lager with Vanilla Beans (Rauchbier Lager with Vanilla Beans)
6pm - Tapping of Barrel Blend #1 (Blend of Bourbon Barrel Aged Eleanor and 15 Locks aged for 13 months in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels)
7pm - Tapping of Grapefruit Lexical Gap IPA (You demanded it, we made it)

Food Trucks:
1-5pm Copper Oven Pizza
5-9pm Toasty Cheese Mobile Eatery

Music:
7-10pm Matt Zach & Tom
events.title: Pollyanna 2nd Anniversary Party
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

events.description:
Thursday, October 27 — 7th Annual Freaktoberfest Beer Tasting Event
13 local craft breweries — as local as they come — offering two specialty brews each. Event begins at 6pm and ends at 11pm. Beer tasting and live music from The Misfits cover band EVILIVE! events.description:
2017 Brewpub Shootout
Chicago Beer Society presents:

19th Annual Chicagoland Brewpub & Microbrewery Shootout

Saturday January 21, 2016

1-5pm

Baderbräu Tap & Brewery

2515 S Wabash Ave, Chicago, IL

Come out and enjoy the best beers paired with the best food from over a dozen Chicago-area brewpubs and microbreweries. Attendees will sample a wide variety of beers as well as each brewpub’s food items and vote for their favorite beer, food, and pairing. Winners will be announced at the end of the event.

Current members will be able to purchase tickets beginning at 10:00am on Friday December 16th for $65.00 each. Use the the code you received via email to purchase tickets.

Individual members can purchase up to 2 tickets. Couples memberships can purchase up to 4 tickets. Your unique code can be used to purchase tickets one time only.

Non-members will be able to purchase any remaining tickets starting at 10:00am on Friday December 30th for $70 each by visiting:

http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/chibeerorg/2727363

Come to support your favorite brewery/brewpub or discover a new favorite – either way, you get to taste the very best beer and food that Chicago has to offer.

SEE YOU THERE!

Ticket sales for current members ($65 each) begin Friday, December 16th, 2016 at 10:00am CST 

Ticket sales for non-members ($70 each) begin Friday, December 30th, 2016 at 10:00am CST
events.title: 2017 Brewpub and Microbrewery Shootout
events.location: Baderbräu Tap & Brewery, 2515 S Wabash Ave, Chicago, IL

events.description:
Don't forget...

After Hanukah, Christmas and New Years comes VALENTINES DAY!

Save the Date!
10th Annual GO Hearts and Hounds Valentines Day Social

When:
Saturday, 2/4/17 from 7-10pm

Where:
Urban Pooch Canine Training
5400 N Damen Ave.
Chicago, IL

Food, open bar, easy parking, pup play area, silent auctions, adoptable dogs, puppy pedicures, live music, and much much more.

We will be featuring beer from Pollyanna Brewing!

We are looking for a committee EARLY this year to help with planning, organizing, fabricating decorations and soliciting donations. Pre-event set up is a great way for teens to get community service hours.

We will need donations so please keep this in mind. If you get two gifts that are the same for the holidays, you could consider donating one as a silent auction item. Or If you find a great sale, GO needs merchandise to raise money for the hounds.

HELP us plan an evening of Greyhound LOVE!

Volunteers are needed to ensure the success of this wonderful event. If you are interested in assisting please contact volunteer@greyhoundsonly.com.

Thanks so much!
events.title: Hearts and Hounds 2017
events.location: Urban Pooch Canine Training 5400 N Damen Ave. Chicago, IL

Additional Info:
Uppers & Downers, a collaboration between Good Beer Hunting and World Barista Champion Stephen Morrissey, is returning to Thalia Hall for a day of coffee, beer, and coffee beers.We keep finding ways of doing more every year.We'll be featuring more than 20 one-off experimental coffee beer collaborations of all styles (see last year's program for examples), nearly a dozen roasters over two sessions all serving single-origin espressos, whiskey coffee cocktails, cold brews, and more.We'll be updating the beer lists as they develop, but here are the highlights so far!SESSION ONE (11a-2p)CASE STUDIES (multiple beers)- Whiner Beer Co. x Four Letter Word Coffee- Goose Island Beer Co.SPECIAL SHOWINGS- Stumptown cold brew bar +beer collabs- Teeling Whiskey coffee cocktailsAND OF COURSE- La Marzocco Home multi-roaster espresso bar- 20+ experimental coffee beers of all styles- small bites from local restaurantsSESSION TWO (3p-6p)CASE STUDIES (multiple beers)- Intelligentsia Coffee xSolemn Oath Brewery- Goose Island Beer Co.SPECIAL SHOWINGS- Stumptown cold brew bar + beer collabs- Teeling Whiskey coffee cocktailsAND OF COURSE- La Marzocco Home multi-roaster espresso bar- 20+ experimental coffee beers of all styles- small bites from local restaurants

events.description:
Our Oktoberfest celebration is back this year and BIGGER and BRONZER than ever. We're proud to be the only brewery in the area pouring a Great American Beer Festival award winning Oktoberfest, so you don't want to miss out on this one! Our Fruhauf Oktoberfest Lager will be keeping those steins full and we're pleased to welcome back Weber Grill Restaurant Lombard, who will be grilling up all sorts of Oktoberfest fare. The music will be bangin', the beer will be flowin', and the lederhosen and drndls will be sportin'. Mark your calendars now!

Saturday, September 16, 2017. 3pm-11pm.
Talcott Square, Lemont, IL.

$10 entrance includes souvenir stein (while supplies last...we bought A LOT more this year), $5 pours of craft beer, live music, and tons of Oktoberfest fun.

Tickets can be purchased at the door. No pre-sale tickets.

Food Menu:
Large and Small Pretzels
Pollyanna Oktoberfest Bier-Cheese Sauce
Smoked Bier-Bratwurst Sandwich with Bacon Kraut
Grilled Cheeseburger
Grilled Mazzie Beer Can Chicken Sandwich
Schweinebraten –Smoked Pork Shoulder Entree with Bier Gravey (made with Pollyanna Lager TBD) and served with Bacon Kraut
All Served with Bavarian Potato Salad
Imported Apple Strudel with Vanilla Sauce

Band Lineup:
Bruce Korosa Polka Band (3:30-6:00)
Acoustic TBD (6-7:30)
Cover Gurl (7:30-10:30)

events.description:
A Series of Fortitudes is our venture into the world of wild yeast and spontaneous fermentation. These beers are uniquely ours and we can't wait to share our introductory offering on Saturday, January 14th. Aged for 12 months in oak barrels with 12 different strains of brettanomyces, "Ernest 1953" is a 9.0% ABV stout with notes of funky cherries and dark fruits that give way to smooth chocolates and soft roasts before yielding to citrus, toffee, wood, and funk in the finish.

12pm bottle and draft release.
750mL bottle $18 (tax included).
No limit.
events.title: A Series of Fortitude - Ernest 1953 Bottle Release

events.description: A Series of Fortitudes is our venture into the world of wild yeast and spontaneous fermentation. These beers are uniquely ours and we can't wait to share our introductory offering on Saturday, January 14th. Aged for 12 months in oak barrels with 12 different strains of brettanomyces, "Ernest 1953" is a 9.0% ABV stout with notes of funky cherries and dark fruits that give way to smooth chocolates and soft roasts before yielding to citrus, toffee, wood, and funk in the finish.

events.description:
Don't just drink and watch the "Big Game".....drink delicious beer and PLAY the game! 

Join us for a double-elimination Tecmo Bowl tournament at Pollyanna Brewing Company to crown the Tecmo Bowl Champion of 2017! We will be hosting two 8-team, double-elimnation brackets, which means we can accept a maximum of 16 competitors. 

Registration as a competitor will be $25 and includes:
Your reserved spot in the tournament
2 Pollyanna Draft Beers
Gelsosimo's Pizza Buffet

We will crown a victor for each of our two tournament brackets...

AND

In the final match of the day we will pit the best agains the best, and see who will emerge as our first ever Pollyanna Brewing Company Tecmo Bowl Champion. 

Prizes (Trophies, Growlers/Howlers of beer, and Pollyanna merch) will be awared to the top players of the night, as well as some fun mini-game prize opportunities thrown in by Baig of Tricks Entertainment.

We will open registration this Saturday, January 21st. 

Instructions will be posted, but just a heads up that all registration will be done through Facebook, so please make sure you've liked both the Baig of Tricks Entertainment and Pollyanna Brewing Company to get the updates as they're posted!
events.title: Techmo Bowl Tournament
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

events.description:
Optimism isn’t just a fool’s errand—any real optimist knows that the world is full of intrigue and mysterious curiosities. It is our job to bring them to light through sheer force of will. Orenda explores the oddity of brewing with the confidence that we’ll come out the other side wiser, more ambitious, and with renewed optimism.

We're excited to release bottles of Orenda Volume 02, our Red Wine barrel aged Belgian Quadrupel. This year, we added brettanomyces to the barrels to make things a bit more intersting.

22oz bombers, no limit
10.4% Alc by Vol
Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon Barrels with Brettanomyces
$15/bottle
events.title: Orenda Volume 02 Bottle Release
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

events.description:
DönerMen is German Imbiss (street food). Where Bavarian beer hall fare is what Americans have come to think of as German food, Imbiss is a popular and rich side of German cuisine that draws from various intersecting food cultures in Europe.

DönerMen is anthropology through food. Try Currywurst, a post-war Berlin invention combining Indian spices via British Imperialism and German sausage in one dish. Or try the other DönerMen stalwart, Döner Kebab, a marriage of flavors brought to Germany by Turkish immigrants in the early 1970's, packaged for the fast pace of modern Berlin.

Sound highfalutin? It’s not. You know how the U.S has tex-mex? This is sorta of a Ger-Turk. Or is it Turk-Ger? Either way it's delicious. 

In this spirit of this emergence, daily specials will evolve to showcase grilled meats and flavor combinations from around the world, but with a tip of the Seppelhut to Deutschland.

Prost!
events.title: Döner Men Food Truck
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

events.description:
No foolin', bromo sapiens, we're throwing a block party to celebrate the opening of our outdoor patio AND releasing two beers. Our wildly popular Raspberry Wheat Ale, "Summerly," will FINALLY be back on draft and in six-packs for the first time this year. We're also jumpin' on the haze craze and releasing our first ever Northeast-style IPA, so cleverly named, "Do You Even Juice, Bro?" Brotally hopped and br-oated up, this beer'll make you wanna be a bro-getter.

Because juice heads love some fresh nectar, we're live bottling this juicy goose from 12-1pm so you can literally buy a bomber directly off the line. Get here early bro-getters! That's some hella fresh haze!

Döner Men food truck will be on hand slingin' some fresh German street food from 12-3pm so you can get your Döner fix.

What kind of block party doesn't have live music? NOT THIS ONE!
Dave Rokos (12-12:30)
The Ramblin' Boys of Pleasure (12:30-1:30)
Matt Zach & Tom (1:30-4:30)

All sorts of block party games and good times will be had by all. So wear your most neon of colors, bust out those tank tops, and grab a cool pair of shades because The Berries and Bros Block Party is all about fun, fun, fun.

Summerly | Raspberry Wheat Ale
4.8% ABV, 18 IBU (draft and six-pack 12oz bottles)

Do You Even Juice, Bro? | NE IPA
6.9% ABV, 69 IBU (draft and 22oz bombers)
events.title: Berries and Bros Block Party
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

events.description:
In 1943, artist Norman Rockwell published the Four Freedoms--interpretations of President Franklin D. Roosevelt's State of the Union Address: Freedom of speech, Freedom of worship, Freedom from want, and Freedom from fear. It shined a light on America's optimistic role in the world, and came to define the era of the New Deal.

A Series of Fortitudes is dedicated to the optimists, who through sheer force of will, propelled their vision into the world and changed the course of history.

Norman 1943
Blonde Ale Brewed with Cardamom Aged in Oak Barrels with Brettanomyces
$15/750mL bottle
No Limit
events.title: Norman 1943 Bottle Release (A Series of Fortitudes)
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439

events.description:
You are cordially invited to the first ever "Day at the Track" on Saturday, April 29th, from 4-8pm featuring your favorite brewery...us! Pollyanna Brewing Company will be featured all day long as part of Hawthorne Race Course's event.

Admission is totally free. We have reserved The Beginner's Luck Lounge where there will be live music as well as plenty of beer, margaritas, and a taco bar available for purchase. Food credits will be available with $10 in free bets, raffle prizes, and all sorts of fun. This is a family friendly event, but you must be 18 to gamble and 21 to drink.

Email your favorite tap room manager, Sheila Callahan, at sheila@pollyannabrewing.com to make a reservation. Space is limited, so RSVP quickly!
events.title: Pollyanna Brewing Day at the Track
events.location: Hawthorne Race Course, 3501 S Laramie Ave, Cicero, IL 60804, USA

events.description:
Our newest taproom, brewery, and fermentarium, "Roselare," is ready to open. 24 draft lines filled with Pollyanna beer, all sorts of to-go beer, and tasty food trucks. We're ready to celebrate our second location up north! Join us all weekend long!

Friday - 12pm to 11pm
Saturday - 12pm to 11pm
Sunday - 12pm to 7pm

Friday Food Trucks - Twisted Classics (12-4pm), BaBy Q's Food Truck (4-9pm)
Saturday Food Trucks - Grumpy Gaucho (12-3pm), Best Truckin' BBQ (5-9pm)

245 E Main St, Roselle, IL 60172
events.title: Pollyanna Roselare Grand Opening
events.location: 245 E Main St, Roselle, IL 60172

events.description:
Who: Pollyanna Brewing Company from Lemont, IL

What: A beer dinner with 4 courses, passed app reception, and a release of their Maple Fun Size Milk Stout that will be making its first debut at our dinner! $75 per person Here's the menu...

Reception

Bavarian Pretzel Bites

The Full Lemonty (American Blonde Ale) 

Course I.

Beignet

Foie Gras, Clementine’s, Polenta Cake , Pickled Red Onion , Soy Caramel 

Mazzie (American Pale Ale)

Course II.

Crab

Yellow Curry, Watermelon, Avocado , Tomato , Radish , King crab  

Cranberry Orange Allure (Berliner Weissbier – sour)  

Course III.

Lamb

36 Hour Braised Lamb Shank, Apricot Puree , Swiss Chard , Moroccan Spiced Jus

Orenda – Volume 1 (Belgian Quad)

Course IV.

Death By Chocolate

Chocolate Cake, Espresso Mouse, Raspberry 

Eleanor Vanilla (Nitro Porter)

Extra

Maple Fun Size (Milk Stout) Release

What we’ll have on tap/cans available for purchase in addition to above –

Personal Chain Letter

Personal Chain Letter Ghost Pepper

Maple Fun Size Cans/Bottles whichever is available

Where: SideDoor (Even though they're from Lemont!)

When: Friday, January 26th, 2018 7:00PM-9:00PM

Contact tsanchez@lawrysonline.onmicrosoft.com for tickets!
events.title: Lawry's/Side Door Beer Dinner
events.location: Lawry's The Prime Rib - Chicago 100 E Ontario St

events.description:
Pollyanna and Skeleton Key have teamed up with Fairway Farms at Cog Hill Country Club in Lemont to bring you a Sow Good Collaboration Event!

Event Details:
-Saturday, May 12th from 12pm-5pm.
-Each brewery is making an identical basil blonde ale, named "Dubs Delight," using freshly grown basil from Lemont's very own Fairway Farms as well as all Illinois grown malted barley! Pollyanna is using Asian Kapoor Tulsi Basil and Skeleton Key is using Citrus Basil.
-Free shuttle between both breweries. Shuttle leaves every half hour, starting at Pollyanna at 12:30pm.
-Proceeds from the event go to Fairway Farms and their sustainability initiative.

Ticket Package Details:
-$25 includes a pint of each brewery's Dubs Delight, a 500mL bottle of each brewery's Dubs Delight to-go, a free shuttle ride between each brewery throughout the afternoon, a 10oz pour of a special one-off variant of each brewery's Dubs Delight, and a plant of each basil to take home!
-Limited to 100 tickets sold.

Pre-sale Tickets available at https://sowgoodcollaborationevent.brownpapertickets.com/

Tickets are NOT required for entrance! Just show up!
events.title: Skeleton Key Collaboration Event (Sow Good Collaboration Event!)
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing and Skeleton Key Brewing

events.description:
Our Oktoberfest celebration is back this year and since it continues to grow and get BIGGER and BRONZER every year, we've moving it to the Lemont Metra Lot just down the street from our brewery! We're proud to be the only brewery in the area pouring a Great American Beer Festival award winning Oktoberfest, so you don't want to miss out on this one! We are also introducing "The Hop Tent" for all you hop heads out there and offering Lynfred Winery wine! Our award winning Fruhauf Oktoberfest Lager will be keeping those steins full and we're pleased to welcome back Weber Grill Restaurant Lombard as well as Gelsosomo's Pizzeria and Pub - Lemont, who will be serving up all sorts of Oktoberfest fare and pizza. The music will be bangin', the beer will be flowin', and the lederhosen and drndls will be sportin'. Mark your calendars now!

Saturday, September 15, 2018. 3pm-11pm.
Lemont Metra Lot, 101 Main St, Lemont, IL

$10 entrance includes souvenir stein (while supplies last...don't worry, we bought A LOT), $5 pours of craft beer, live music, and tons of Oktoberfest fun.

The Hop Tent will feature a brand new NE IPA, Brut IPA, Wet Hop IPA, and our Lexical Gap West Coast IPA.

Tickets can be purchased at the door or before the event at https://2018-pollyanna-oktoberfest.eventbrite.com

Weber Grill Restaurant Lombard
-Large and Small Grilled Pretzels
-Pollyanna Fruhauf Bier-Cheese Sauce
-Smoked Bier-Bratwurst Sandwich with Bacon Kraut
-Grilled Cheeseburger
-Grilled Mazzie Beer Can Chicken Sandwich
-Schweinebraten –Smoked Pork Shoulder Entree w/ Bier Gravy (made w/ Humpenscrump) and served w/ Bacon Kraut
-All Served with Bavarian Potato Salad
-Imported Apple Strudel with Vanilla Sauce

Gelsosomo's Pizzeria and Pub - Lemont
-Beer Chili
-Buffalo and Full Lemonty BBQ Chicken Legs
-Homemade Meatballs
-Italian Sausage and Pepper Kabobs
-Pizza
-Eleanor Chocolate Cupcakes

Dinky Delights, Inc.
-Fresh donuts for your sweet tooth craving!
Band Lineup:
Bruce Korosa Orchestra Polka Band (3:30-5:30)
Camoflouge Sun (5:30-7:30)
Jimmy Nick (8:30-10:30)

As a reminder, this is an adult environment, but kids are welcome to enjoy the music, food, and limited selection of soft drinks and water. All we ask is that you keep an eye on them as they are amongst adults consuming adult beverages. We will not allow dogs into this event, but remember that we are dog friendly outside every other day of the year!
events.title: Pollyanna Oktoberfest (Lemont)
events.location: Lemont Metra Lot, 101 Main St, Lemont, IL

events.description:
We're kicking off our favorite drinking holiday at noon on Friday, March 16th and continuing it all day Saturday, March 17th. Join us for live music, traditional Irish food, and a brand new beer release! For the first time ever we're brewing "Mexican Hot Chocolate Irish Red Ale," an Irish Red with Cocoa Nibs, Vanilla Beans, Cinnamon, and Cayenne Pepper. This will be draft only and available to-go in howlers/growlers.

On Saturday March 17th, we're also hosting a St Baldrick's event. Come shave your head for charity!
events.title: St Patrick's Day Weekend Party!
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 245 E Main St, Roselle, IL

events.description:
This Summer, we're moving our big beer fest to Roselle! We want to show off our new location, so if you haven't been to our second home yet, this is your chance to check out Roselare! On Saturday, June 9th, we're closing down the street in front of the brewery for all sorts of live music, local food trucks and food vendors, and craft beer. We hope to see you all there!

Saturday, June 9th 3-11pm
Pollyanna Brewing Company Roselare
245 E Main St, Roselle, IL 60172

$10 entrance includes a souvenir mug (while supplies last...don't worry, we have a lot), live music, access to food trucks, and $5 fills of Pollyanna beer in your souvenir mug.

Live music:
Grace & John Music
Jimmy Nick
Alt 101

Food:
Smokin' BBQ Kitchen
Italian Pizza Kitchen
And more to be announced!

As a reminder, this is an adult environment, but kids are welcome to enjoy the music, food, and limited selection of soft drinks and water. All we ask is that you keep an eye on them as they are amongst adults consuming adult beverages.

Don't worry, Lemont, our Oktoberfest will bigger and better than ever on 9/15 in our hometown of Lemont.

Cheers!
events.title: Pollyanna Summer Beer Fest (Roselle)
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 245 E Main St, Roselle, IL

events.description:
Beer. Wine. Meat. Coffee.
Pollyanna Brewery + Lynfred Winery + Rockin Rodizio = Fist Bumps

Monday, June 18 
6:30-9:00 PM
Pollyanna Brewing Company Roselare
245 E Main St, Roselle, IL 60172

Carnivores and locavores will rejoice. We will meat in the Pollyanna Roselare Beer Garden for family-style dining of five courses coming off the Rockin Rodizio, including gourmet grilled cheese, the Abe Froman Special: sausages, chicken legs, beef tenderloin with peppers, and cinnamon sugar pineapples.  $55 per person includes dinner and 2 drink tickets for beer or wine.

Additional beer and wine for purchase. 21 and over.

events.description:
Pastry stout nerdz rejoice! Bourbon Barrel Aged Toasted Marshmallow Fun Size is finally coming out of barrels! Bottles and draft sales will commence at both breweries at 12pm (Noon) on Saturday, June 2. This will likely be a tap room only beer and not available for distribution.

Bourbon Barrel Aged Toasted Marshmallow Fun Size
7.0% ABV, 500mL bottle
$10/bottle (tax included)
6 bottle limit***

-We will have cash and credit lines at both breweries. We suggest having cash on hand to keep the line moving quickly.
-Bottle sales will be located outside the brewery only during the initial rush (weather dependent).
-Draft sales will be located inside the brewery only (weather dependent).
-Please respect our neighbors, our brewery, and each other. Let's keep craft beer fun.

Mug club members check your inbox.

***we reserve the right to change this depending on the release day’s crowd.
events.title: Bourbon Barrel Aged Toasted Marshmallow Fun Size Bottle/Draft Release (Lemont)
events.location: Pollyanna Brewing Company, 431 Talcott Ave, Lemont, IL 60439
